com.game.characters

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.game.characters.GameCharacter
      • com.game.characters.Creature
        • com.game.characters.Player
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Fighter, Mage, Thief

    public abstract class Player
extends Creature
    This is a controllable character with a specified starting inventory. The behavior of each the player's defined class (Thief, Mage, or Fighter) on level-up has been defined for each individual Enum type. Every player should be represented by an avatar of a specific class and gender and can be drawn on screen
    Author:
    TBworkstation
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getRespawnTime

        public int getRespawnTime()
        Description copied from class: Creature
        Returns the respawn time according to the type of creature it is. If it is a player, it will be shorter than a monster's respawn time
        Specified by:
        getRespawnTime in class Creature
        Returns:
        the respawn time as an integer in game ticks
